Definition of Indicator: CO2 produced transporting food waste to the AD plant  / insect farm or redistributing edible food waste.
Big n Smart AD: Trucks travelling to large AD plants emit CO2, but Decreasearbonisation efforts mean that many will utilise biogas, H2 or are EV so emissions will be less in the future.   Electrification has reduced demand for transport fuel, and the remainder is met with biofuels.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Trucks transporting surplus food will emit some CO2, but Decreasearbonisation efforts mean that many will utilise biogas, H2 or are EV so emissions will be less in the future.  More efficient travel coefficients exist, eg. better use made of returning trucks after deliveries to supermarkets also has a positive impact on CO2 emissions
Big n Smart Insect protein: Transporting Food Waste for insect production produces small amounts of CO2. More CO2 emissions in transporting end-product (especially if for live insect market).  Transport coefficients are good under the Big n Smart scenario, and utilisation of EV, and more efficient technologies further Decreasereases emissions.
Create n Cope AD: Less CO2 produced in transport processes,  many will utilise biogas, H2 or are EV therefore emissions reduce  in the future.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Trucks transporting surplus food will emit some CO2, but Decreasearbonisation efforts mean that many will utilise biogas, H2 or are EV so emissions will be less in the future.  More efficient travel coefficients exist, eg. better use made of returning trucks after deliveries to supermarkets also has a positive impact on CO2 emissions
Create n Cope Insect protein: Transporting Food Waste for insect production produces small amounts of CO2. More CO2  will be emitted  in transporting the end-product (especially if for live insect market).  Transport coefficients have improved to make efficient journeys.
Share n Connect AD: Fossil fuels are a very small part of fuel mix, so CO2 emissions are substantially reduced, and as the scale of AD is often smaller, means less transport distance for the Food Waste.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Trucks transporting surplus food will emit some CO2, but Decreasearbonisation efforts mean that many will utilise biogas, H2 or are EV so emissions will be less in the future.  More efficient travel coefficients exist, eg. better use made of returning trucks after deliveries to supermarkets also has a positive impact on CO2 emissions
Share n Connect Insect protein: Transporting Food Waste for insect production produces small amounts of CO2, although most production and consumption is small scale and local so emissions are minimal.

Definition of Indicator: Amount of water consumed by the innovation
Big n Smart AD: High future water demand, water is scarce, particularly in Southern regions.  AD operators are effectively and efficiently sourcing grey water and other liquids for AD purposes, and not adding to abstraction of general water supply.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: If surplus food is redistributed and fed to people, this should have a positive impact on water consuption with food not being 'wasted'. If the third of food that is wasted in the UK was eaten, production levels could Decreaserease and much less water would be used in farming.
Create n Cope AD: Moderate water demand but unpredictable supply. AD has innovated to ensure demand for fresh water is as low as possible (to ensure security of supply)
Create n Cope Food redistribution: If surplus food is redistributed and fed to people, this should have a positive impact on water consuption with food not being 'wasted'. If the third of food that is wasted in the UK was eaten, production levels could Decreaserease and much less water would be used in farming.
Share n Connect AD: Demand lower than previously due to new innovations, but still requires effective water services. Water scarcity still a possibility, but managed well for most of the year.   Water quality has also improved.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: If surplus food is redistributed and fed to people, this should have a positive impact on water consuption with food not being 'wasted'. If the third of food that is wasted in the UK was eaten, production levels could Decreaserease and much less water would be used in farming.

Definition of Indicator: The amount of food waste (or surplus food, for Food Redistribution) available. Quality is important.
Big n Smart AD: FW utilised by bioenergy in large scale AD. Less overproduction, Efficient separation of edible FW.   Food waste arising Decreasereases (to a lesser extent than share and connect) due to more efficient stock management, use of smart tech, e.g. automated shopping and smart fridges. Capture of waste arising Increasereases a lot (e.g. due efficiency and optimisation or radically different waste interception mechanisms e.g. maceration). Capture of foodwaste remains centralised. Does not necessarily alter the quality of the food waste collected (quality is important). More goes to AD (because it is a preferred way of processing organic waste in a low-carbon society).
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Surplus Food is less common than before due to efficiency of production process and better monitoring and response to demand. If a food surplus does arise, there are mechanisms in place to make use of the resource, ensuring it complies with the food waste hierarchy, be best to be fed to a person if possible, then an animal, only then to be considered for energy (AD) or composting.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Distinguish between mixed FW and 'pure' FW streams.  FW origin knowledge is important for insect protein production due to: a) reliability of rearing and nutritional content of reared insects, and b) legal aspects of food supply chain health and safety standards. .   Less overproduction, Efficient separation of edible FW.   Food waste arising Decreasereases  due to more efficient stock management, use of smart tech, e.g. automated shopping and smart fridges. Capture of waste arising Increasereases a lot (e.g. due to efficiency and optimisation).
Create n Cope AD: Easier to collect waste now due to more use of food courts, so overall a similar or slightly greater amount available.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Surplus Food is less common than before, but due to unpredictability of overseas produce, more UK based food production. If a food surplus does arise, there are mechanisms in place to make use of the resource, ensuring it complies with the food waste hierarchy, be best to be fed to a person if possible, then an animal, only then to be considered for energy (AD) or composting.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Distinguish between mixed FW and 'pure' FW streams.  FW origin knowledge is important for insect protein production due to: a) reliability of rearing and nutritional content of reared insects, and b) legal aspects of food supply chain health and safety standards.    Less overproduction (Food surplus), and less waste due to high food costs which led to more efficient stock management,  smart fridges etc.  Food waste capture Increasereases a lot (e.g. due to efficiency and optimisation) although for insect production.
Share n Connect AD: Food waste is Decreaselining due to avoidance and reuse, but an Increasereasing proportion of that arising is now captured (e.g. because of entrepreneurs and community actors working to make sure as much as possible is captured to reuse – for this same reason food waste is also therefore of higher quality i.e. better seperation of surplus, organic waste, other recyclables). In addition a greater proportion of food waste (not surplus) is directed to AD  (because AD is a preferred way of processing organic waste in a low-carbon society) but not necessarily going via local authority / other waste collection (eg.personal/community AD plant).
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Food supply chains have Decreasereased, more localised food production. Less food surplus, but if it does arise, there are mechanisms in place to make use of the resource, ensuring it complies with the food waste hierarchy, be best to be fed to a person if possible, then an animal, only then to be considered for energy (AD) or composting.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Food waste quality and steady supply is important for insect production. FW origin knowledge is important for insect protein production due to: a) reliability of rearing and nutritional content of reared insects, and b) legal aspects of food supply chain health and safety standards.   Less overproduction (Food surplus) in this scenario and also less waste due to local production.  Food waste capture Increasereases, although for insect production single stream waste (with quantifiable nutrients) is better than mixed waste.

Proposed name shortening (Nik): Separate Waste Collection/Food Waste Recycling/Food Waste Collection (don't like FW abbreviation)
Definition of Indicator: improves feedstock availability and the rate of other recyclables
Big n Smart AD: Organic waste became a more valuable resource, making separate FW collection more cost-effective, almost all unavoidable FW is now processed (at Large scale) for bioenergy and fertiliser production.
Create n Cope AD: Less FW available due to Increasereased food costs , but all waste is now separated and treated as a valuable resource.
Share n Connect AD: Less FW available due to Increasereased local production and less avoidable waste, but all waste is now separated and treated as valuable resource.

Proposed name shortening (Nik): Digestate Produced (or maybe have two separate rows?)
Definition of Indicator: Usually a cost for disposal. Issues often related to perceived quality of the digestate (contamination)
Big n Smart AD: Digestate produced at large scale is a valuable byproduct. UK agriculture is becoming Increasereasingly self-sufficient.  Digestate is a more viable option in drought conditions due to high liquid content. Digestate likely to be a resource rather than a cost for disposal in the future, however may be issues  with the quality of the digestate due to feedstock contamination. Certification (PAS110) ensures quality control.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Frass has begun to be seen as a valuable organic fertiliser, although it is only produced at relatively small scale.  May be processed via AD to produce energy as often Increaseludes waste food.
Create n Cope AD: Digestate produced at large scale, and is particularly  valuable in drought conditions due to high liquid content.  Digestate likely to be considered a resource rather than a cost for disposal in the future. in agricultural applications it is being used as a method to produce nutrients and manage land (offsetting use of EU and globally produced fertilisers, or energy intensive UK produced fertilisers).  May be issues  with the quality of the digestate due to feedstock contamination. Certification (PAS110) ensures quality control.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Frass has begun to be seen as a valuable organic fertiliser, although it is only produced at relatively small scale.  May be processed via AD to produce energy as often Increaseludes waste food.
Share n Connect AD: likely to value and utilise digestate as local community will process non-avoidable FW for micro/small scale AD. Digestate more likely to be a driver as there is a  local market for it.  Smaller scale production – local use and low transport costs at small scale. Cost implications of pasturisation and certification though, although prohibitively expensive permitting costs for small-scale AD have been abolished.  Quality control of feedstock is easier in this scenario.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: N.A.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Frass has begun to be seen as a valuable organic fertiliser, although it is only produced at relatively small scale. Frass may be processed via AD to produce energy as often Increaseludes waste food.

Big n Smart AD: Incentives decreased over time as AD became more widespread and profit margins for biogas improved
Big n Smart Food redistribution: No incentives currently. In the future Food Redistribution could be incentivised, but in this scenario less Food surplus and less demand.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Currently no incentives for Insect protein production
Create n Cope AD: Incentives decreased in the future as efficiency is now much greater and energy production is profitable
Create n Cope Food redistribution: No incentives currently. In the future Food Redistribution could be incentivised, but likely to be  less Food surplus available.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Currently no incentives for Insect protein production - may change in the future to help establish the innovation in the same way renewables were incentivised.
Share n Connect AD: Incentives decreased in the future as efficiency is now much greater and energy production is profitable
Share n Connect Food redistribution: No incentives currently. In the future Food Redistribution could be incentivised, but now less Food surplus and less demand.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Currently no incentives for Insect protein production - may change in the future to help establish the innovation in the same way renewables were incentivised.

Definition of Indicator: Amount of Biogas generated by AD plant
Big n Smart AD: Amount of Biogas generated will depend on the quality of the Feedstock. Waste Food has fairly high calorific value (although highly variable). In this scenario, process optimisation has Increasereased biogas production levels.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope AD: Amount of Biogas generated will depend on the quality of the Feedstock.  Food Waste has fairly high calorific value (although highly variable). In this scenario, process optimisation has Increasereased biogas production levels.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope Insect protein: N.A.
Share n Connect AD: Local communities are highly technically / mechanically skilled. Small scale biogas production widespread,biogas is used locally (eg café/communal cooking). Optimisation has improved output via shared learning.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: N.A.
Share n Connect Insect protein: N.A.

Definition of Indicator: Use of heat from AD plants
Big n Smart AD: Large scale biogas production gives rise to surplus heat (most heat produced in Combined Heat & Power CHP - ie electricity generation from biogas). This heat can be utilised in synergystic innovations (eg insect protein production, growing vegetables eg tomatoes). Heat can also be used for a different part of the AD process, eg drying or concentrating digestate or for the pasteurisation process.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Utilisation of synergystic innovations (eg. AD surplus heat) may make insect production more viable in the UK.
Create n Cope AD: Large scale biogas production gives rise to surplus heat (most heat produced in Combined Heat & Power CHP - ie electricity generation from biogas). This heat can be utilised in synergystic innovations (eg insect protein production, growing vegetables eg tomatoes). Heat can also be used for a different part of the AD process, eg drying or concentrating digestate or for the pasteurisation process.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Utilisation of synergystic innovations (eg. AD surplus heat) may make insect production more viable in the UK.
Share n Connect AD: Small scale biogas production enables biogas to be used for local  heating / cooking. Less surplus heat produced at small scale.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: N.A.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Utilisation of synergystic innovations (eg. AD surplus heat) may make insect production more viable in the UK.

Definition of Indicator: Utilisation of energy from AD
Big n Smart AD: Large scale biogas production gives rise to surplus heat (most heat produced in Combined Heat & Power CHP - ie electricity generation from biogas). This heat can be utilised in synergystic innovations (eg insect protein production, growing vegetables eg tomatoes). Heat can also be used for a different part of the AD process, eg drying or concentrating digestate or for the pasteurisation process.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope AD: Large scale biogas production gives rise to surplus heat (most heat produced in Combined Heat & Power CHP - ie electricity generation from biogas). This heat can be utilised in synergystic innovations (eg insect protein production, growing vegetables eg tomatoes). Heat can also be used for a different part of the AD process, eg drying or concentrating digestate or for the pasteurisation process.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope Insect protein: N.A.
Share n Connect AD: Small scale biogas production enables biogas to be used for local  heating / cooking. Less surplus heat produced at small scale.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: N.A.
Share n Connect Insect protein: N.A.

Definition of Indicator: Air Quality Increases levels of polluting Greenhouse Gases, Increaseluding CO2, N2O, NH4
Big n Smart AD: AD means less emissions of methane and other green house gases to the environment (compared to putting organic waste to landfill). Bioenergy production is also cleaner than electricity generation using fossil fuels.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Due to most vehicles being electrified or running on biofuel, transportation of Food for redistribution does not contribute much to Decreaserease in air quality. In fact, if we consider this food as being 'saved' and that slightly less will need to be produced it will have a positive impact on air quality.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Due to most vehicles being electrified or running on biofuel, transportation of Food for redistribution does not contribute much to Decreaserease in air quality. In fact, if we consider this food as being 'saved' and that slightly less will need to be produced it will have a positive impact on air quality.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Due to most vehicles being electrified or running on biofuel, transportation of Food for redistribution does not contribute much to Decreaserease in air quality. In fact, if we consider this food as being 'saved' and that slightly less will need to be produced it will have a positive impact on air quality.

Definition of Indicator: Quality of soil, will be improved by addition of organic matter such as Digestate and Frass, can help with resilience to drought and Increasereases soil fertility.
Big n Smart AD: Digestate readily available as an organic fertiliser however,restrictions still exist on the  frequency of application and timing of the digestate. Helps to Increase moisture retention.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Frass can be used as an organic fertiliser to improve soil quality
Create n Cope AD: With more uncertain rainfall, more important to Increaserease soil org matter to retain moisture.  Digestate and oany other organic matter added to the soil helps retain moisture levels.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A
Create n Cope Insect protein: Frass can be used as an organic fertiliser to improve soil quality
Share n Connect AD: More likely to be beneficial to soil quality at smaller scale so higher impact in Share’n’Connect. Availability of digestate good from small scale AD at local level.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Frass can be used as an organic fertiliser to improve soil quality

Definition of Indicator: This indicator looks at the change in the amount of agricultural, forest and other semi-natural and natural land taken by urban and other artificial land development. It Increaseludes areas sealed by construction and urban infrastructure.
Big n Smart AD: Becomes an important indicator, especially if crops grown for AD feedstock. Intensification may lead to Decreaserease in biodiversity and Increasereased water use
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Ensuring all edible food is eaten contributes to efficient agricultural production and Decreasereased land take. If  food is wasted, then more land is needed to produce more food.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Much less land is required for producing insect protein than for farming traditional meat such as beef, lamb and pork.
Create n Cope AD: Volatile climate Increasereases risk, but agriculture has responded to the Increasereased volatility by relocation and diversification. At the UK level co-operation, intensification innovation and diversification allow  land take to remain at a similar level.  Better use  is made of brownfield sites e.g. hydroponic / indoor growing methods as these are resistant to outdoor variaton in temp/rainfall etc.)
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Ensuring all edible food is eaten contributes to efficient agricultural production and Decreasereased land take. If  food is wasted, then more land is needed to produce more food.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Much less land is required for producing insect protein than for farming traditional meat such as beef, lamb and pork.
Share n Connect AD: Increasereased land use (but of ex-industrial land).  Large diversification has changed farming practices. More co-operative production
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Ensuring all edible food is eaten contributes to efficient agricultural production and Decreasereased land take. If  food is wasted, then more land is needed to produce more food.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Much less land is required for producing insect protein than for farming traditional meat such as beef, lamb and pork.

Definition of Indicator: Investment needed to build the AD plant / Insect farm.
Big n Smart AD: May Decreaserease with investment from Germany & Japan for large scale plants, and due to economy of scale Decreasereasing component costs.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Big n Smart Insect protein: May Decreaserease as insect farms become more common, due to economy of scale Decreasereasing component costs.
Create n Cope AD: More LA investment at all scales, build costs of new plants Decreasereases with Increasereasing popularity of AD.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope Insect protein: May Decreaserease as insect farms become more common, due to economy of scale Decreasereasing component costs.
Share n Connect AD: More communities invest in small scale AD drives price down.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: N.A.
Share n Connect Insect protein: May Decreaserease as insect farms become more common, due to economy of scale Decreasereasing component costs.

Definition of Indicator: Cost of maintaining production over the lifecycle of the innovation.
Big n Smart AD: May Decreaserease with investment from Germany & Japan for large scale plants
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Most vehicles run on biogas or are electrified so transport costs are not as high as with fossil fuel. Less food to redistribute as less surplus is produced due to better data driven production methods. Unfortunately still some requirement for food due to high costs
Big n Smart Insect protein: Costs for heating for insect protein production are high, innovations investigating other species that may be more amenable to the UK climate. Costs can be offset by synergies with AD, eg using waste heat produced.
Create n Cope AD: More LA investment at all scales
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Most vehicles run on biogas or are electrified so transport costs are not as high as with fossil fuel. Less food to redistribute as less surplus is produced due to better data driven production methods. Unfortunately still some requirement for food due to high costs
Create n Cope Insect protein: Costs for heating for insect protein production are high, innovations investigating other species that may be more amenable to the UK climate. Costs can be offset by synergies with AD, eg using waste heat produced.
Share n Connect AD: More communities invest in small scale AD drives price down
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Most vehicles run on biogas or are electrified so transport costs are not as high as with fossil fuel. Less food to redistribute as less surplus is produced due to better data driven production methods. Unfortunately still some requirement for food due to high costs
Share n Connect Insect protein: Costs for heating for insect protein production are high, innovations investigating other species that may be more amenable to the UK climate. Costs can be offset by synergies with AD, eg using waste heat produced.

Definition of Indicator: Transport costs for Food waste transportation to AD plant/insect farm  and for transporting any products or by-product
Big n Smart AD: Large scale AD requires significant transport, but sophisticated monitoring / management improves efficiency
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Most vehicles run on biogas or are electrified so transport costs are not as high as with fossil fuel. Less food to redistribute as less surplus is produced due to better data driven production methods. Unfortunately still some requirement for food due to inequalities.
Create n Cope AD: Increaserease in onsite renewable energy production. Decreasereases transport costs to some extent.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: transport costs are high in this scenario. Less food to redistribute as less surplus, but due food is Increasereasingly produced locally. Unfortunately still some requirement for food due to inequalities.
Share n Connect AD: community led AD reduces transport costs - more local collection, small scale
Share n Connect Insect protein: transport costs remain high. Less food to redistribute as less surplus, but due food is Increasereasingly produced locally. Unfortunately still some requirement for food due to inequalities.

Definition of Indicator: Gate fee costs should decrease by not sending organic waste to landfill
Big n Smart AD: With the Increasereasing value of recyclables and organic waste gate fees reduce over time as waste is considered a valuable resource.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Edible food waste is rare due to data driven production, and inedible waste, along with other organic waste streams, is processed for animal feed and bioenergy.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Edible food waste is rare and inedible waste, along with other organic waste streams, is processed for animal feed and bioenergy.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Edible food waste is rare, and inedible waste, along with other organic waste streams, is processed for animal feed and bioenergy.

Definition of Indicator: Costs associated with by-product disposal (Digestate or Frass). By-product likely to be considered a valuable resource in the future and may become a financial benefit rather than cost
Big n Smart AD: Increasereased demand for digestate alongside synergistic climate controlled food production utilising waste heat.  Costs Decreaserease
Create n Cope AD: Increasereased demand for digestate (esp in drought conditions) drives up demand and Decreasereases disposal costs
Share n Connect AD: Local level use from community level AD (less transport costs for digestate disposal).

Definition of Indicator: The amount of edible surplus food redistributed to those in need of it. (Ideally this would not be required)
Big n Smart AD: Data driven industry Decreasereases commercial FW availability
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Edible food waste is rare due to data driven production, and inedible waste, along with other organic waste streams, is processed for animal feed and bioenergy.  Less demand that previously.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Edible food waste is a thing of the past, and inedible waste, along with other organic waste streams, is processed for animal feed and bioenergy. However, demand still exists due to volatile food market prices and Increasereased transport costs pushing up food cost.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Less demand due to more community level food programmes/shared kitchens

Definition of Indicator: The disturbance caused to the landscape visually for people living close to the innovation.
Big n Smart AD: Increasereased population size and spread of cities makes it harder to locate large AD plants away from  populated areas. Numbers adversely affected likely to Increaserease, although people likely to be more tolerant as they understand the benefits of AD.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Insect farms often co-located with AD plants to make use of surplus heat.  People have become accustomed to the look of the insect farms so relatively little impact visually.
Create n Cope AD: More farm led AD due to need to diversify. Increasereases the number of people negatively affected.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Insect farms tend to be reasonably small scale, so little impact visually.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Insect farms tend to be reasonably small scale, so little impact visually.

Definition of Indicator: How socially acceptable the innovation is to the local community.
Big n Smart AD: Acceptance of AD Increasereases as people realise the social and environmental benefits
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Awareness of food poverty has Increasereased and people have become more socially aware, that food redistribution is required is not socially acceptable, with little edible food waste available, the government had to act to ensure everyone had access to Decreaseent nutrition.
Create n Cope AD: Acceptance of AD Increasereases as people realise the social and environmental benefits
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Awareness of food poverty has Increasereased and people have become more socially aware, that food redistribution is required is not socially acceptable, with little edible food waste available, the government had to act to ensure everyone had access to Decreaseent nutrition.
Share n Connect AD: Small scale, co-owned AD plants become more commonplace and more acceptable within the community as people recognise the social and environmental benefits as well as the economic.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Awareness of food poverty has Increasereased and people have become more socially aware.   Little surplus food to redistribute, but with 'share and connect', there is much more social sharing of food going on aided by technology such as apps where food retailers can advertise their 'end of day' produce to be discounted and therefore not wasted.

Definition of Indicator: Improvements to Quality of Life due to the Innovation
Big n Smart AD: Widespread use of AD has contributed to QoL by contributing to energy security, employment and regional development.  Farmers using slurry for AD means that smell (and emissions of methane and Nox) has Decreasereased for people living in rural areas.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: Much less need for food redistribution, although many people supplement their diet with nutritional supplements, especially for protein. Meat consumption much lower.
Create n Cope AD: Widespread use of AD has contributed to QoL by contributing to energy security meaning less blackouts, and by using slurry for AD smell has Decreasereased for people living in rural areas.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: Much less need for food redistribution, although food is expensive and there is less choice.  Diets are often supplemented with nutraceuticals (subsidised by the government). Communal eating more popular
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Much more social sharing of food via supper clubs etc. Less requirement for organised food redistribution

Definition of Indicator: Regional diversification due to the innovation, should improve resilience.
Big n Smart AD: Large scale AD contributes to regional development, particularly of 'brownfield' sites being redeveloped around large urban areas.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Contributes to diversification of farming and local regional development
Create n Cope AD: Large scale AD contributes to regional development, particularly of 'brownfield' sites being redeveloped around large urban areas.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A
Create n Cope Insect protein: Contributes to diversification of farming and local regional development
Share n Connect AD: AD contributes to regional development (at the community level). May act as a synergystic innovation to establish 'Innovation Hubs'.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: N.A.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Contributes to diversification of farming and local regional development

Definition of Indicator: Employment from Waste Resource use
Big n Smart AD: Increasereasing number of jobs in the bioenergy sector as the number of AD plants Increasereases.Increasereasing number of jobs in the bioenergy sector as the number of AD plants Increasereases.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Investors support creative thinking and social enterprise opportunities and business ventures are commonplace, creating jobs in new sectors such as insect farming.
Share n Connect AD: Many people working 20-25 hours a week, giving time for community enterprise such as local AD as a waste and energy solution.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Sharing society encourages exchange of skills/knowledge and cross fertilisation of ideas Increasereasing entrepreneurial activity particularly community based initiatives (such as insect farming) which create local jobs

Definition of Indicator: Better education helps lead to more sustainable resource use
Big n Smart AD: Many large AD plants offer educational visits to their plants, Increasereases awareness and acceptance of the technology. Better education helps lead to more sustainable resource use and helps  Decreaserease contaminantion of food waste.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Education has improved the acceptibility of insect protein and as a consequence the demand has Increasereased significantly.  Education has been shared between innovators setting up new insect farms.
Create n Cope AD: Many large AD plants offer educational visits to their plants, Increasereases awareness and acceptance of the technology.  Better education helps lead to more sustainable resource use and helps  Decreaserease contaminantion of food waste.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Education has improved the acceptibility of insect protein and as a consequence the demand has Increasereased significantly.  Education has been shared between innovators setting up new insect farms.
Share n Connect AD: Better education helps lead to more sustainable resource use and helps  Decreaserease contaminantion of food waste.   Community led AD leads to the education of those involved with the innovation. Knowledge sharing is high.
Share n Connect Insect protein: Education has improved the acceptibility of insect protein and as a consequence the demand has Increasereased significantly.  Education has been shared between innovators setting up new insect farms.

Definition of Indicator: Sharing expertise can lead to similar innovation activity (Cluster effect)
Big n Smart AD: Knowledge sharing to optimise AD operational activities is likely to become more widespread.  Knowldege of other European optimisation processes for AD shared to Increaserease overall productivity.
Big n Smart Food redistribution: knowledge sharing helped to identify requirements for food redistribution which has Increasereased awareness of the problem and spurred the Government to act to improve nutrition in those who cannot afford to pay for sufficient food.
Create n Cope AD: Knowledge sharing to optimise AD operational activities is likely to become more widespread.  Knowldege of other European optimisation processes for AD shared to Increaserease overall productivity.
Create n Cope Food redistribution: knowledge sharing helped to identify requirements for food redistribution which has Increasereased awareness of the problem and spurred the Government to act to improve nutrition in those who cannot afford to pay for sufficient food.
Share n Connect AD: Knowledge sharing in and between communities is high. Better education helps lead to more sustainable resource use and helps  Decreaserease contaminantion of food waste.   Community led AD leads to the education of those involved with the innovation.
Share n Connect Food redistribution: Community led projects where knowledge sharing helped identify requirements for food redistribution led to reduced future need.

Big n Smart AD: Better grid infrastructure facilitates biogas being utilised by industry and in residential areas.  Much higher benefit utilising gas directly than transferring the gas to electricity (CHP).
Big n Smart Food redistribution: N.A.
Create n Cope AD: Some grid infrastructure in place in this scenario which facilitates biogas being utilised by industry and in residential areas.  Much higher benefit utilising gas directly than transferring the gas to electricity (CHP).
Create n Cope Food redistribution: N.A
Create n Cope Insect protein: N.A.
Share n Connect AD: Most AD is smaller scale, although some community investment has improved infrastructure enabling biogas to be utilised by local businesses, boosting synergystic growth and developing 'Hubs' of innovation.

Definition of Indicator: Impact on Biosecurity due to the innovation ; Biosecurity issues from waste exist, hence need for regulations.  Pasteurisation kills pathogens.
Big n Smart AD: Biosecurity issues from waste exist. For AD, PAS certification requires pasteurisation  this kills harmful pathogens.
Big n Smart Insect protein: Biosecurity is an important consideration in Insect protein production, need to ensure non-native species do not escape
Create n Cope AD: Biosecurity issues from waste exist. For AD, PAS certification requires pasteurisation  this kills harmful pathogens.
Create n Cope Insect protein: Biosecurity is an important consideration in Insect protein production, need to ensure non-native species do not escape
Share n Connect AD: Biosecurity issues from waste exist. For AD, PAS certification requires pasteurisation  this kills harmful pathogens.

Definition of Indicator: Change in regulations problematic. Costs, compliance, complexity. Complying with regulations can be a large percentage of set up costs for AD (30% MB TM)
Big n Smart AD: Complying with regulations can be a large percentage of set up costs for AD (30% ), but likely to be less at larger scales.  For more details on current regulations relating to AD see  http://www.biogas-info.co.uk/about/regulation/    Regulations exist for use of Digestate (PAS 110 accreditation), and also for the use of Animal by-products. Also Environmental permitting (EP is a scheme in England & Wales/regulated by SEPA in Scotland). Health & Safety regulations associated with flammable atmospheres, toxic gases and confined spaces also to be complied with.
Big n Smart Insect protein: As insect protein becomes more mainstream and recognised as a food source, regulations should improve the ease of production. At the  moment they tend to be regulated indirectly (e.g. the ban on feeding animals to animals which inadvertently ruled out insects). In the future it's very likely that insects can be fed to  pigs and poultry (able to be fed to fish already).
Create n Cope AD: Complying with regulations can be a large percentage of set up costs for AD (30% ), but likely to be less at larger scales.  For more details on current regulations relating to AD see  http://www.biogas-info.co.uk/about/regulation/    Regulations exist for use of Digestate (PAS 110 accreditation), and also for the use of Animal by-products. Also Environmen tal permitting (EP is a scheme in England & Wales). Health & Safety regulations associated with flammable atmospheres, toxic gases and confined spaces also to be complied with.
Create n Cope Insect protein: As insect protein becomes more mainstream and recognised as a food source, regulations will improve the ease of production. At the  moment they tend to be regulated indirectly (e.g. the ban on feeding animals to animals which inadvertently ruled out insects). In the future it's very likely that insects can be fed to  pigs and poultry (able to be fed to fish already).
Share n Connect Insect protein: As insect protein becomes more mainstream and recognised as a food source, regulations will improve the ease of production. At the  moment they tend to be regulated indirectly (e.g. the ban on feeding animals to animals which inadvertently ruled out insects). In the future it's very likely that insects can be fed to  pigs and poultry (able to be fed to fish already).

Definition of Indicator: Availability of relevant skills required to successfully deploy the innovation
Big n Smart AD: Working patterns change, growth areas manufacturing and construction which makes building new, large AD plants easier, alliances with Germany brings Increasereased AD expertise to the UK.
Create n Cope AD: Agriculture sector has diversified and many people now work in energy production, Increasereased access to skilled AD workers.
Share n Connect AD: Many community based AD projects with corresponding educational programmes leads to a steady supply of relevant skills

Definition of Indicator: Availability of relevant technology  required to successfully deploy the innovation
Big n Smart AD: Alliences with Germany/Japan , plus UK based R&D improves access to relevant large-scale AD technology. There may be a general lack of availability of technology for small-scale renewables, as dependence on large-scale energy and issues around energy justice and equity become more pronounced as prices rise.
Create n Cope AD: Increasereased government and Local authority funding improves innovation in AD technologies, plus economy of scale makes access easier.
Share n Connect AD: Extensive investment and R&D in micro and small scale community AD has improved the technology and Decreasereased prices

Definition of Indicator: Benefits to the purity of Ground water due to the innovation.
Big n Smart AD: AD improves water quality when digestate is used as a fertiliser in comparison to manures/slurries.
Create n Cope AD: AD improves water quality when digestate is used as a fertiliser in comparison to manures/slurries.
Share n Connect AD: AD improves water quality when digestate is used as a fertiliser in comparison to manures/slurries.

Definition of Indicator: Ensuring  diverse sources of energy to ensurea secure energy supply.
Big n Smart AD: Use of biofuels has Increasereased energy security along with other renewables. Especially important in replacing transport fuels, although electrification is Decreasereasing demand.
Create n Cope AD: Use of biofuels has Increasereased energy security although fuel prices remain high and conventional fuels are still common.  Less people own cars in this scenario due to high costs, shipping industry is using biogas to transport waste.
